name: Pumpkin Ravioli
steps: Mound flour on a clean work surface and make well in center. Crack egg into center.
Beat eggs lightly with a fork. Gradually incorporate flour into eggs, starting with inner rim of well.
Once mixed, knead dough until smooth and elastic. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
While dough is resting, cut pumpkin into small chunks, finely chop shallot, and mince garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped pumpkin and saut√© until pumpkin is tender and caramelized, about 10-15 minutes, adding shallot and garlic part way through.
Transfer pumpkin to a bowl to cool slightly. Once cooled, mash until smooth.
In a medium bowl, mix pumpkin with parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, nutmeg, and allspice.
Once dough is ready, roll into a thin sheet over a lightly floured surface.
Scoop pumpkin filling out onto dough spaced 1-2 inches apart on the top half of the dough. Fold in half and press put air bubbles to seal in filling. Trim edges with a pasta cutter.
Bring pot of salted water to a boil. Gently add ravioli to the pot and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add 1/4 cup of water and cornstarch, stirring until the mixture thickens. Season with salt. Crumble biscuits into sauce and mix well.
Remove ravioli and drizzle with butter sauce and some extra Parmesan cheese to taste.
